application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA
description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

The Google Cloud Healthcare and Life Sciences team helps Healthcare and Life Science customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team, you'll help shape the future of research, clinical, pharmaceutical and other Healthcare and Life Sciences related businesses and research organizations and help them scale their data and processes.

As a Program Manager, you'll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You'll plan requirements with internal customers and partners, and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience managing complex day-to-day work streams with diverse internal and external stakeholders.
  • Experience with healthcare IT or data governance (security, privacy, compliance).
  • Experience working work collaboratively with internal and external cross-functional teams; external-facing customer or partner experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with large scale roll outs of complex IT solutions in healthcare or clinical research settings.
  • Experience with medical imaging technologies, PACS, healthcare integrations, electronic health records.
  • Familiarity with data standards including HL7v2 and FHIR.
  • Knowledge of cloud technologies or experience in integrating cloud technologies in healthcare settings; familiarity with ML/AI technologies.
  • Understanding of regulatory requirements (e.g. HIPAA, PIPEDA/PHIPA, GDPR, etc.) and governing bodies (e.g. FDA, NIH, NHS, ISO, etc.).
  • Excellent communication, process optimization, and collaboration skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead complex strategic efforts for a product area within Cloud Healthcare and Life Sciences (HCLS); manage day-to-day work streams with diverse internal and external stakeholders; ensure stakeholder alignment across key milestones and deliverables.
  • Become a trusted expert in Google Cloud Platform and its deployment in Healthcare and Life Sciences organizations and provide effective operational and technical advice around these technologies.
  • Channel customer feedback to Product Management and Engineering teams to ensure the best possible in-production experience.
title: Program Manager, Cloud Healthcare and Life Sciences
